nav.div: Monmouth - Roseville CUSD #238 » News » What's New » COVID -19

em.span:
Dear TitanNation,
The Governor announced today that in-person instruction will not return for the remainder of the school year. I have to admit that this announcement hurts my heart tremendously, but deep down I feel this is the correct decision to make. Please know that this is NOT the end of the school year. We still must make every effort to provide remote learning for our students each and every day until the school year ends. If you have any questions ... please contact your building principal. Sincerely, Superintendent Edward Fletcher
Click to read an announcement regarding school closure ENGLISH SPANISH FRENCH CHIN
Click to read an announcement regarding April school closure: ENGLISH, SPANISH, FRENCH, CHIN

span.span:
On Monday March 30, 2020 M-R released the following information for parents regarding the State Board of Education's stance on "Remote Learning"
Click to read the update: ENGLISH, SPANISH, FRENCH, CHIN

br.span:
If you or your student(s) have any questions during the school closure or if your child needs any support, please call the school your child attends and leave a voice message. Messages will be forwarded to the appropriate staff member for a reply.
LINK to school numbers
- - -

span.span: MEAL PICK UP UPDATE: beginning Monday, 3/30 bagged meal pick up will be on MONDAYS, WEDNESDAYS, FRIDAYS only.
span.br:
- - -
3/20/20 Education Resources #KEEPLEARNING
IL State Board of Education has released information regarding FREE resources to exist to assist us during closure. It is possible your cell company and internet provider is lifting data caps and overages fees. Click here for the ISBE press release and be sure to check with your provider!
- - - - -
3/19/20 When to call the doctor?
